homepage.features.browserMemo.descriptio.message: A lightweight memo function usable only in the browser.

homepage.features.diary.description.message: Daily records and personal miscellaneous notes.

homepage.features.exams.description.message: Study notes and reviews for certification exams.

homepage.features.news.description.message: A list of sites useful for daily information gathering.

homepage.features.tech.description.message: Organizing daily learnings and blog posts.

homepage.meta.description.description: The meta description for the homepage

news.page.description.message: A curated list of news sites to help you keep up with domestic and international affairs and technology trends.

news.site.int.ap.bbc.desc.message: The international broadcasting arm of the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC), established in 1932. It delivers news and documentaries to a global audience in over 40 languages via radio, online, and podcasts.

news.site.int.ap.cnn.desc.message: Audio content such as news and documentaries provided by CNN.

news.site.int.ap.economist.desc.message: In-depth analysis podcasts on politics and economics from The Economist magazine.

news.site.int.ap.npr.desc.message: The weekend news and information program from the U.S. public radio, NPR.

news.site.int.ap.sed.desc.message: A podcast and blog offering daily news, interviews, and discussions on software engineering.

news.site.int.ge.afp.desc.message: A French news agency, successor to an organization founded in 1835 by Charles-Louis Havas. It is the world's oldest and has a strong focus on visual reporting, including photography and video.

news.site.int.ge.aljazeera.desc.message: Established in 1996 with funding from the Qatari government. Operated by Al Jazeera Media Network. An international news organization that broadcasts global news from a Middle Eastern and Arab world perspective, distinct from Western media.

news.site.int.ge.ap.desc.message: A non-profit cooperative news agency founded in 1846 by five New York City newspapers. Known for its speed and objectivity, it supplies news stories to media outlets worldwide.

news.site.int.ge.bi.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 2007 by Henry Blodget and others. Operated by Axel Springer SE. It provides timely news on business and technology and has multiple international editions worldwide.

news.site.int.ge.bloomberg.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 1981 by Michael Bloomberg. A leading global economic and financial media company, with the 'Bloomberg Terminal' financial data and analysis tool at its core.

news.site.int.ge.chinadaily.desc.message: The only English-language daily newspaper published by the Communist Party of China. It conveys China's official views and developments.

news.site.int.ge.digiday.desc.message: An international edition of a specialized media that delves into the transformation of digital media, marketing, advertising, and retail.

news.site.int.ge.fox.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 1996 by Rupert Murdoch. Operated by Fox News Media. A cable news network known for its conservative perspective, recording high viewership ratings in the United States.

news.site.int.ge.lemonde.desc.message: Founded in France in 1944 by Hubert Beuve-Méry. The English edition of France's leading newspaper, valued for its detailed analysis of international affairs and high-quality investigative reporting.

news.site.int.ge.nikkei.desc.message: Launched in 2013 by Nikkei Inc. Reports on Asian business, economy, and politics in English from the perspective of a Japanese media company. Known for its specialized reporting on Asia.

news.site.int.ge.reuters.desc.message: Founded in the UK in 1851 by Paul Julius Reuter. Operated by Thomson Reuters. A global news agency known for its fact-based, impartial, and timely reporting, with operations in over 190 countries.

news.site.int.ge.wsj.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 1889 by Charles Dow and others. Operated by Dow Jones & Company, a subsidiary of News Corp. Characterized by high-quality investigative reporting in the business and finance sectors.

news.site.int.ss.alltop.desc.message: A news aggregator that collects top news and blog posts on a variety of topics.

news.site.int.ss.bellingcat.desc.message: An independent investigative group founded in 2014 by Eliot Higgins. Known for its method of investigating and analyzing conflicts and crimes using open-source intelligence (OSINT). Registered as a non-profit foundation in the Netherlands.

news.site.int.ss.ground.desc.message: Founded in Canada in 2017 by former NASA engineers including Harleen Kaur. A platform that visualizes the political bias (left, center, right) of various media outlets on a single news story, enabling multi-faceted information comparison.

news.site.int.ss.icij.desc.message: A non-profit investigative journalism organization founded in the U.S. in 1997 by Charles Lewis. Known for projects like the 'Panama Papers' and 'Pandora Papers,' it pursues wrongdoing through cross-border collaboration.

news.site.int.ss.intercept.desc.message: Founded in 2014 by Glenn Greenwald and others. Operated by First Look Media. Prompted by the reporting of the Edward Snowden documents, it champions adversarial journalism on issues such as national surveillance, war, and human rights.

news.site.int.ss.marshall.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 2014 by Neil Barsky. A non-profit news organization focused on the U.S. criminal justice system, aiming to raise public awareness of inequalities within the system.

news.site.int.ss.newsnow.desc.message: A news aggregator that gathers the latest headlines in real-time from news sources around the world.

news.site.int.ss.occrp.desc.message: Founded in 2006 by Drew Sullivan and Paul Radu. An international non-profit network of investigative journalists specializing in organized crime and corruption. It collaborates with media worldwide to expose cross-border crime.

news.site.int.ss.propublica.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 2007 by Paul Steiger and others. A non-profit investigative journalism organization with a mission to expose abuses of power and betrayals of public trust, funded by the Sandler Foundation. It has won numerous Pulitzer Prizes.

news.site.int.ts.geekwire.desc.message: Reports on technology, startups, and innovation news, with a focus on Seattle and the Pacific Northwest.

news.site.int.ts.mit.desc.message: Founded and operated by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) since 1899. One of the world's most authoritative technology magazines, analyzing the commercial, political, and social impact of emerging technologies.

news.site.int.ts.sciencedaily.desc.message: A news website that delivers daily press releases on the latest scientific research.

news.site.int.ts.scitech.desc.message: A media outlet that broadly covers the latest research and news in science and technology.

news.site.int.ts.techcrunch.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 2005 by Michael Arrington. Operated by Yahoo Inc. A leading media outlet reporting on startups and the technology industry, also known for hosting the large-scale conference 'Disrupt'.

news.site.int.ts.wired.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 1993 by Louis Rossetto and others. Operated by Condé Nast. A media outlet that has influenced the world with its style of deeply exploring the impact of technology on culture, economy, and politics, and contemplating the future.

news.site.jp.ge.47news.desc.message: Established in 2006. Operated by Zenkoku Shimbun Net Co., Ltd. Kyodo News and 52 local newspapers across Japan participate, providing news from both central and local perspectives.

news.site.jp.ge.bi.desc.message: The Japanese edition of the business media outlet founded in the U.S. in 2007 by Henry Blodget, operated by Mediagene Inc. Primarily targeting millennials, it delivers news on business, finance, and technology.

news.site.jp.ge.bloomberg.desc.message: The Japanese edition of Bloomberg L.P., founded in the U.S. in 1981 by Michael Bloomberg. Its core business is the 'Bloomberg Terminal' financial information terminal, wielding significant influence in finance and economics.

news.site.jp.ge.minkabu.desc.message: Founded in 2006 by Ken Uryu. Operated by MINKABU THE INFONOID, Inc. Provides original content specializing in financial information for individual investors, such as stock price forecasts using AI and crowd input.

news.site.jp.ge.nikkei.desc.message: Founded in 1876 by Takashi Masuda (founder of Mitsui & Co.). Operated by Nikkei Inc. Known for its specialized economic reporting and is the source of the Nikkei Stock Average. Acquired the British Financial Times in 2015.

news.site.jp.ge.reuters.desc.message: The Japanese edition of the international news agency founded in the UK in 1851 by Paul Julius Reuter. Operated by Thomson Reuters. One of the world's three largest news agencies, featuring a global news-gathering network with high reporting speed.

news.site.jp.ge.sekaikabuka.desc.message: A site specializing in displaying market data such as major global stock indices, forex, commodity futures, and cryptocurrencies at a glance.

news.site.jp.ge.yahoo.desc.message: Launched in 1996. Operated by LY Corporation. Rooted in Yahoo! Inc., founded by Jerry Yang and others. Japan's largest news aggregator, delivering news from numerous content providers.

news.site.jp.lw.tenki.desc.message: The official weather forecast media of the Japan Weather Association. Also rich in disaster prevention information.

news.site.jp.lw.yahoo.desc.message: Weather forecast and disaster information by Yahoo! Japan.

news.site.jp.pr.kyodo.desc.message: Press release distribution service operated by Kyodo News. Provides highly reliable corporate information.

news.site.jp.pr.prtimes.desc.message: Japan's largest press release distribution service. Get the latest corporate information quickly.

news.site.jp.sec.ipa.desc.message: A public agency under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry, established in 2004. It technically supports Japan's IT national strategy and is responsible for publishing the '10 Major Security Threats' and administering the Information Technology Engineers Examination.

news.site.jp.sec.secnext.desc.message: Launched in 2004. A specialized news site for cybersecurity and personal information protection, operated by News-Gaea, Inc. It provides prompt reporting on incidents and vulnerabilities.

news.site.jp.ss.ceek.desc.message: A news search engine that allows cross-searching of major domestic news sites.

news.site.jp.ts.ascii.desc.message: A web media originating from 'Monthly ASCII,' first published in 1977 by Kazuhiko Nishi and others. Operated by KADOKAWA ASCII Research Laboratories, Inc. It has a history dating back to the dawn of personal computers in Japan and provides timely news on PCs, IT, and gadgets.

news.site.jp.ts.cnet.desc.message: The Japanese edition of the technology news site founded in the U.S. in 1994 by Halsey Minor and others. Operated by Asahi Interactive, Inc. It has a strong focus on IT product reviews and information on enterprise solutions.

news.site.jp.ts.gigazine.desc.message: Launched in 2000 by Keito Yamazaki and operated by OSA Inc. Known for its in-depth articles based on unique perspectives and detailed reporting. It covers a wide range of topics from gadget reviews to science and food culture.

news.site.jp.ts.mit.desc.message: The Japanese edition of the world's oldest technology magazine, first published by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) in 1899. Operated by KADOKAWA ASCII Research Laboratories, Inc. It analyzes the social and economic impact of new technologies.

news.site.jp.ts.wired.desc.message: The Japanese edition of the technology culture magazine founded in the U.S. in 1993 by Louis Rossetto and others. Operated by Condé Nast Japan. It explores the impact of technology on culture, society, and lifestyle, and is known for its future-oriented insights.

news.site.jp.tv.asahi.desc.message: The news site of TV Asahi. Disseminates information from a unique perspective.

news.site.jp.tv.fuji.desc.message: A news distribution site by the news department of Fuji TV.

news.site.jp.tv.nhk.desc.message: The comprehensive news site of the Japan Broadcasting Corporation (NHK). Provides a wide range of domestic and international news.

news.site.jp.tv.ntv.desc.message: The news site of Nippon Television. Provides news with high timeliness.

news.site.jp.tv.tbs.desc.message: The news site of TBS Television. Reports in detail on current affairs and social issues.

news.site.jp.tv.tx.desc.message: TV Tokyo's specialized site for economic and business news.

page.browser-memo.alert.restoreFailed.message: Failed to restore memos. The link may be corrupted.

page.browser-memo.alert.urlTooLongConfir.message:
The generated URL is very long due to the large amount of text. Please note that it may not work in some cases.

We recommend using a URL shortening service when using this URL.

page.browser-memo.confirm.clearAll.message: Are you sure you want to clear all memos? This action cannot be undone.

page.browser-memo.confirm.restoreAll.message: Do you want to restore the shared memos? Your current memos will be overwritten.

page.browser-memo.description.message: A simple notepad to temporarily save text in your browser.

page.browser-memo.intro1.message: A simple notepad that works entirely in your browser. Your input is automatically saved to this browser.

page.browser-memo.notes.backup.message: This is a lightweight tool. It is strongly recommended that you back up any important data separately.

page.browser-memo.notes.storage.message: Your notes are automatically saved when you pause typing or when the text area loses focus.

page.browser-memo.notes.urlLengthWarning.message: If your notes are very long, the generated shareable URL will also be very long. We recommend using a URL shortening service when sharing.

theme.blog.paginator.olderEntries.description: The label used to navigate to the older blog posts page (next page)

theme.blog.post.paginator.olderPost.description: The blog post button label to navigate to the older/next post

theme.CodeBlock.copyButtonAriaLabel.description: The ARIA label for copy code blocks button

theme.CodeBlock.copied.description: The copied button label on code blocks

theme.colorToggle.ariaLabel.mode.light.description: The name for the light color mode

theme.colorToggle.ariaLabel.mode.system.description: The name for the system color mode

theme.common.skipToMainContent.description: The skip to content label used for accessibility, allowing to rapidly navigate to main content with keyboard tab/enter navigation

theme.contentVisibility.draftBanner.mess.message: This page is a draft. It will only be visible in dev and be excluded from the production build.

theme.contentVisibility.unlistedBanner.m.message: This page is unlisted. Search engines will not index it, and only users having a direct link can access it.

theme.docs.DocCard.categoryDescription.p.description: The default description for a category card in the generated index about how many items this category includes

theme.docs.paginator.navAriaLabel.description: The ARIA label for the docs pagination

theme.docs.paginator.next.description: The label used to navigate to the next doc

theme.docs.paginator.previous.description: The label used to navigate to the previous doc

theme.docs.sidebar.collapseButtonAriaLab.description: The title attribute for collapse button of doc sidebar

theme.docs.sidebar.collapseButtonTitle.description: The title attribute for collapse button of doc sidebar

theme.docs.sidebar.closeSidebarButtonAri.description: The ARIA label for close button of mobile sidebar

theme.docs.sidebar.expandButtonAriaLabel.description: The ARIA label and title attribute for expand button of doc sidebar

theme.docs.sidebar.expandButtonTitle.description: The ARIA label and title attribute for expand button of doc sidebar

theme.docs.sidebar.navAriaLabel.description: The ARIA label for the sidebar navigation

theme.docs.sidebar.toggleSidebarButtonAr.description: The ARIA label for hamburger menu button of mobile navigation

theme.docs.tagDocListPageTitle.description: The title of the page for a docs tag

theme.docs.tagDocListPageTitle.nDocsTagg.description: Pluralized label for "{count} docs tagged". Use as much plural forms (separated by "|") as your language support (see https://www.unicode.org/cldr/cldr-aux/charts/34/supplemental/language_plural_rules.html)

theme.docs.versions.latestVersionLinkLab.description: The label used for the latest version suggestion link label

theme.docs.versions.latestVersionSuggest.description: The label used to tell the user to check the latest version

theme.docs.versions.unmaintainedVersionL.message: This is documentation for {siteTitle} {versionLabel}, which is no longer actively maintained.
theme.docs.versions.unmaintainedVersionL.description: The label used to tell the user that he's browsing an unmaintained doc version

theme.docs.versions.unreleasedVersionLab.message: This is unreleased documentation for {siteTitle} {versionLabel} version.
theme.docs.versions.unreleasedVersionLab.description: The label used to tell the user that he's browsing an unreleased doc version

theme.DocSidebarItem.collapseCategoryAri.description: The ARIA label to collapse the sidebar category

theme.DocSidebarItem.expandCategoryAriaL.description: The ARIA label to expand the sidebar category

theme.ErrorPageContent.title.description: The title of the fallback page when the page crashed

theme.ErrorPageContent.tryAgain.description: The label of the button to try again rendering when the React error boundary captures an error

theme.lastUpdated.atDate.description: The words used to describe on which date a page has been last updated

theme.lastUpdated.byUser.description: The words used to describe by who the page has been last updated

theme.lastUpdated.lastUpdatedAtBy.description: The sentence used to display when a page has been last updated, and by who

theme.NavBar.navAriaLabel.description: The ARIA label for the main navigation

theme.navbar.mobileDropdown.collapseButt.description: The ARIA label of the button to collapse the mobile dropdown navbar item
The ARIA label of the button to expand the mobile dropdown navbar item

theme.navbar.mobileLanguageDropdown.labe.description: The label for the mobile language switcher dropdown

theme.navbar.mobileSidebarSecondaryMenu..description: The label of the back button to return to main menu, inside the mobile navbar sidebar secondary menu (notably used to display the docs sidebar)

theme.navbar.mobileVersionsDropdown.labe.description: The label for the navbar versions dropdown on mobile view

theme.NotFound.p1.message: We could not find what you were looking for.
theme.NotFound.p1.description: The first paragraph of the 404 page

theme.NotFound.p2.message: Please contact the owner of the site that linked you to the original URL and let them know their link is broken.

theme.SearchBar.label.description: The ARIA label and placeholder for search button

theme.SearchModal.errorScreen.helpText.message: You might want to check your network connection.
theme.SearchModal.errorScreen.helpText.description: The help text for error screen of search modal

theme.SearchModal.errorScreen.titleText.description: The title for error screen of search modal

theme.SearchModal.footer.closeKeyAriaLab.description: The ARIA label for the Escape key button that close the modal

theme.SearchModal.footer.closeText.description: The explanatory text of the action for Escape key

theme.SearchModal.footer.navigateDownKey.description: The ARIA label for the Arrow down key button that makes the navigation

theme.SearchModal.footer.navigateText.description: The explanatory text of the action for the Arrow up and Arrow down key

theme.SearchModal.footer.navigateUpKeyAr.description: The ARIA label for the Arrow up key button that makes the navigation

theme.SearchModal.footer.searchByText.description: The text explain that the search is making by Algolia

theme.SearchModal.footer.selectKeyAriaLa.description: The ARIA label for the Enter key button that makes the selection

theme.SearchModal.footer.selectText.description: The explanatory text of the action for the enter key

theme.SearchModal.noResultsScreen.noResu.description: The text explains that there are no results for the following search

theme.SearchModal.noResultsScreen.report.description: The text for the link to report missing results

theme.SearchModal.noResultsScreen.report.message: Believe this query should return results?
theme.SearchModal.noResultsScreen.report.description: The text for the question where the user thinks there are missing results

theme.SearchModal.noResultsScreen.sugges.description: The text for the suggested query when no results are found for the following search

theme.SearchModal.placeholder.description: The placeholder of the input of the DocSearch pop-up modal

theme.SearchModal.searchBox.cancelButton.description: The label and ARIA label for search box cancel button

theme.SearchModal.searchBox.resetButtonT.description: The label and ARIA label for search box reset button

theme.SearchModal.startScreen.noRecentSe.description: The text when no recent searches

theme.SearchModal.startScreen.removeFavo.description: The label for remove favorite search button

theme.SearchModal.startScreen.removeRece.description: The label for remove recent search button

theme.SearchModal.startScreen.saveRecent.description: The label for save recent search button

theme.SearchPage.algoliaLabel.description: The ARIA label for Algolia mention

theme.SearchPage.emptyResultsTitle.description: The search page title for empty query

theme.SearchPage.existingResultsTitle.description: The search page title for non-empty query

theme.SearchPage.fetchingNewResults.description: The paragraph for fetching new search results

theme.SearchPage.inputLabel.description: The ARIA label for search page input

theme.SearchPage.inputPlaceholder.description: The placeholder for search page input

theme.SearchPage.noResultsText.description: The paragraph for empty search result

theme.tags.tagsListLabel.description: The label alongside a tag list

theme.tags.tagsPageLink.description: The label of the link targeting the tag list page

theme.tags.tagsPageTitle.description: The title of the tag list page

theme.TOCCollapsible.toggleButtonLabel.description: The label used by the button on the collapsible TOC component

links.page.description.message: A collection of useful links to technical documents and tools for development and learning.

links.site.cloud.gcp.desc.message: Complete GCP documentation with quickstarts, tutorials, and comprehensive guides.

links.site.cloud.gcpArch.desc.message: The Cloud Architecture Center provides reference architectures, design guidance, and best practices.

links.site.cloud.gcloud.desc.message: Documentation for the Google Cloud CLI, including gcloud, gsutil, and bq command-line tools.

links.site.cloud.gcpSecurity.desc.message: Documentation and best practices for Google Cloud security.

links.site.cloud.aws.desc.message: Comprehensive documentation covering all AWS services.

links.site.cloud.awsArch.desc.message: The AWS Architecture Center, including guidance from the Well-Architected Framework.

links.site.cloud.awsWhitepapers.desc.message: AWS whitepapers on cloud architecture and best practices.

links.site.cloud.k8s.desc.message: Official documentation for Kubernetes, the de facto standard for container orchestration.

links.site.cloud.docker.desc.message: Official documentation for Docker, the de facto standard for container virtualization.

links.site.cloud.terraform.desc.message: Official documentation for the leading tool to implement Infrastructure as Code.

links.site.cloud.pulumi.desc.message: A modern IaC tool that uses familiar programming languages.

links.site.cloud.ansible.desc.message: Official documentation for the tool that automates configuration management and provisioning.

links.site.cloud.gcb.desc.message: A managed service for running CI/CD pipelines on GCP.

links.site.cloud.ghactions.desc.message: A CI/CD platform integrated into GitHub for automating workflows.

links.site.cloud.gitlab.desc.message: A DevOps platform that integrates everything from source code management to CI/CD.

links.site.cloud.helm.desc.message: Official documentation for Helm, the package manager for Kubernetes.

links.site.backend.python.desc.message: Official Python 3 documentation, from language specifications to the standard library.

links.site.backend.django.desc.message: A Python framework for rapid development of robust and scalable web applications.

links.site.backend.drf.desc.message: A powerful and flexible toolkit for building Web APIs in Django.

links.site.backend.fastapi.desc.message: A modern, fast web framework for Python 3.6+ based on type hints.

links.site.backend.flask.desc.message: A lightweight and extensible micro web framework for Python.

links.site.backend.node.desc.message: Official documentation for the asynchronous event-driven JavaScript runtime.

links.site.backend.express.desc.message: A fast, unopinionated, minimalist web framework for Node.js.

links.site.backend.nestjs.desc.message: A Node.js framework for building efficient, scalable server-side applications.

links.site.backend.go.desc.message: A simple, efficient, statically typed compiled language developed by Google.

links.site.backend.rust.desc.message: A systems programming language that focuses on safety, speed, and concurrency.

links.site.backend.kotlin.desc.message: A modern, pragmatic programming language that runs on the JVM.

links.site.backend.graphql.desc.message: A query language for APIs, allowing clients to request only the data they need.

links.site.backend.grpc.desc.message: A high-performance RPC framework developed by Google, using Protocol Buffers by default.

links.site.backend.openapi.desc.message: A standard specification for describing RESTful APIs, with a rich ecosystem.

links.site.backend.swagger.desc.message: A set of API development tools based on the OpenAPI Specification.

links.site.data.bigquery.desc.message: A serverless data warehouse for analyzing petabyte-scale data.

links.site.data.dataflow.desc.message: A managed service for executing stream and batch data processing pipelines.

links.site.data.dataproc.desc.message: A managed service for Apache Spark and Hadoop.

links.site.data.composer.desc.message: A managed service for Apache Airflow.

links.site.data.postgres.desc.message: A powerful, open source object-relational database system.

links.site.data.mysql.desc.message: One of the world's most popular open-source relational databases.

links.site.data.redis.desc.message: A fast, in-memory key-value data store.

links.site.data.duckdb.desc.message: A fast, in-process analytical database engine.

links.site.data.pandas.desc.message: A data analysis library for Python, powerful for DataFrame manipulation.

links.site.data.numpy.desc.message: A numerical computing library for Python, essential for multi-dimensional array operations.

links.site.data.dbt.desc.message: The "T" in ELT. A tool to help transform data in your data warehouse.

links.site.data.supabase.desc.message: An open source Firebase alternative, based on PostgreSQL.

links.site.data.sqlzoo.desc.message: A site for learning SQL through interactive tutorials and exercises.

links.site.ai.vertexai.desc.message: A unified ML platform on GCP for building, deploying, and scaling ML models.

links.site.ai.mlcrashcourse.desc.message: A practical, fast-paced course on ML fundamentals, created by Google engineers.

links.site.ai.gcpa.desc.message: Documentation for all of GCP's AI services, including translation, speech, and vision.

links.site.ai.tf.desc.message: An end-to-end open-source platform for machine learning, developed by Google.

links.site.ai.pytorch.desc.message: An ML library known for its Define-by-Run approach, widely adopted in research.

links.site.ai.sklearn.desc.message: A leading machine learning library for Python for classification, regression, and clustering.

links.site.ai.mlflow.desc.message: An open-source platform to manage the complete machine learning lifecycle.

links.site.ai.kubeflow.desc.message: A platform for deploying and managing ML workflows on Kubernetes.

links.site.ai.dvc.desc.message: A tool for data and model versioning that integrates with Git.

links.site.ai.wandb.desc.message: A platform to help track, visualize, and reproduce ML experiments.

links.site.ai.hf.desc.message: A hub for transformer models and libraries for Natural Language Processing (NLP).

links.site.ai.kaggle.desc.message: The world's largest community for data science competitions, datasets, and learning resources.

links.site.ai.colab.desc.message: An environment for running Python in your browser, especially for ML, with free GPU access.

links.site.frontend.mdn.desc.message: The de facto standard for web technologies. Official reference for HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

links.site.frontend.webdev.desc.message: Best practices for modern web development from Google, covering performance, accessibility, and more.

links.site.frontend.react.desc.message: A declarative JavaScript library for building component-based user interfaces.

links.site.frontend.nextjs.desc.message: A production framework for React, offering various rendering strategies.

links.site.frontend.ts.desc.message: A superset of JavaScript that adds static typing to enhance robustness for large-scale development.

links.site.frontend.vite.desc.message: A next-generation frontend tool featuring a fast development server and build process.

links.site.frontend.tailwind.desc.message: A utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom designs directly in your HTML.

links.site.frontend.shadcnui.desc.message: A new approach to UI components: copy and paste them into your project.

links.site.frontend.mui.desc.message: A popular React UI framework that implements Google's Material Design.

links.site.frontend.figma.desc.message: A browser-based UI/UX design tool with powerful real-time collaboration features.

links.site.frontend.storybook.desc.message: A tool for developing and documenting UI components in isolation.

links.site.frontend.playwright.desc.message: A framework for automating reliable end-to-end testing.

links.site.frontend.caniuse.desc.message: An essential tool for checking browser support for frontend technologies.

links.site.devtools.git.desc.message: Official documentation for the distributed version control system, Git.

links.site.devtools.github.desc.message: Official documentation for GitHub features like code hosting, collaboration, and Actions.

links.site.devtools.learngit.desc.message: An excellent interactive and visual tool for learning Git branching.

links.site.devtools.regex101.desc.message: A powerful online tool for creating, testing, and debugging regular expressions in real time.

links.site.devtools.godbolt.desc.message: An interactive tool to see how your code is compiled by various compilers.

links.site.devtools.replit.desc.message: An online IDE for coding, compiling, running, and sharing code directly from your browser.

links.site.devtools.roadmap.desc.message: Learning roadmaps for various tech domains, showing you what to learn next.

links.site.devtools.hackernews.desc.message: A tech news site run by Y Combinator, where geeks from around the world discuss.

links.site.devtools.exercism.desc.message: A platform to practice coding skills in over 50 languages with mentorship.

links.site.devtools.leetcode.desc.message: A collection of algorithm and data structure problems, ideal for tech interview prep.

links.site.docs.docusaurus.desc.message: A static site generator built with React, optimized for creating documentation websites.

links.site.docs.gitbook.desc.message: A modern platform for easily creating, hosting, and managing technical documentation.

links.site.docs.mkdocs.desc.message: A fast, simple static site generator for building project documentation with Markdown.

links.site.docs.obsidian.desc.message: A powerful knowledge base tool that works on local Markdown files, acting as a second brain.

links.site.docs.logseq.desc.message: A privacy-first, non-linear outliner-style knowledge base.

links.site.docs.notion.desc.message: An all-in-one workspace that combines documents, databases, wikis, and more.

links.site.docs.excalidraw.desc.message: A virtual whiteboard tool for easily creating hand-drawn style diagrams and wireframes.

links.site.docs.mermaid.desc.message: A library that generates diagrams and charts from Markdown-like text.

links.site.docs.plantuml.desc.message: A tool for quickly creating UML diagrams from a simple text description language.

links.site.specialized.rn.desc.message: Build cross-platform mobile apps using React.

links.site.specialized.flutter.desc.message: Build beautiful UIs for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase.

links.site.specialized.unity.desc.message: The world's leading platform for 2D and 3D game development.

links.site.specialized.godot.desc.message: A feature-rich, cross-platform game engine that is completely free and open source.

links.site.specialized.solidity.desc.message: The primary programming language for implementing smart contracts on Ethereum.

links.site.specialized.owasp.desc.message: An open community dedicated to improving the security of web applications.

links.site.specialized.portswigger.desc.message: A free, online learning resource for web security vulnerabilities, from PortSwigger.
